summary: Email correspondence from July 2021 regarding efforts to authenticate FedEx shipping records for use as evidence in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss contacting FedEx Legal and preparing records for admission as an exhibit.

persons.name: Tracy
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney or legal contact
persons.context: Addressed in emails regarding authentication of FedEx records; appears to be the primary contact for the legal request.

connections.description: M introduces Tracy to assist with authenticating FedEx records for the Epstein case, indicating a professional legal or investigative collaboration.

events.title: Contact with FedEx Legal
events.description: A contact at FedEx Legal is found who indicates authenticating FedEx records for the Epstein case should not be a problem.

events.title: Records Prepared for Exhibit
events.description: Actual FedEx records are attached to an email for admission as an exhibit in the Epstein case, with plans to locate cover paperwork or custodian affidavit.

keyFacts: FedEx shipping records are being authenticated for use as evidence in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal efforts in July 2021 to prepare exhibits, suggesting active case work years after Epstein's death.
A contact at FedEx Legal was engaged to assist with authentication of records.
The attached file '2002-10-397-85573_REGARDINGJEFFREY_E_EPSTEIN.pdf' suggests the FedEx records may date to 2002 and relate to Jeffrey Epstein.
